Commentary: round the wicket, very full, very straight, patted to the off side
Commentary_short: Imad Wasim to Gunathilaka, no run

Commentary: just a hint of turn from a restrictive leg-stump line, clipped square
Commentary_short: Imad Wasim to Gunathilaka, no run

Commentary: a shuffle to the leg-side from Gunathilaka, opening up his arms, but can't get the flat, quick dart away
Commentary_short: Imad Wasim to Gunathilaka, no run

Commentary: fired across the left-hander, lovely angle to beat the outside edge
Commentary_short: Imad Wasim to Gunathilaka, no run

Commentary: whoops! That wasn't quite the accuracy we've come to expect. Way down the leg side, turning even further to beat the keeper, and just about clawed in with a scramble at fine leg
Commentary_short: Imad Wasim to Gunathilaka, 4 wides

Commentary: tight line once more, defended on the back foot
Commentary_short: Imad Wasim to Fernando, no run

Commentary: flicked to the leg side to get off the mark. A probing over
Commentary_short: Imad Wasim to Fernando, 1 run

Commentary: a touch of width, and clobbered through point! The extra pace comes onto the bat so sweetly, and Fernando didn't miss out there!
Commentary_short: Faheem Ashraf to Fernando, FOUR runs

Commentary: tapped with firm timing into the covers, and gathered with a slide
Commentary_short: Faheem Ashraf to Fernando, 1 run

Commentary: cracked down the ground with a roll of the wrists, and a bit of a limp attempt to shy at the stumps from mid-off. Flew so wide of the cut strip...
Commentary_short: Faheem Ashraf to Gunathilaka, 2 runs

Commentary: quality biffing! Makes room outside leg, hits cleanly through the line, on the up, whistling to the long-off rope!
Commentary_short: Faheem Ashraf to Gunathilaka, FOUR runs

Commentary: tighter line, met with a high-elbowed defensive drive, looking to be forceful but staying watchful
Commentary_short: Faheem Ashraf to Gunathilaka, no run

Commentary: bashed firmly into the covers, excitement in the crowd as short cover fumbles, but that wasn't a catch. Made decent ground to intercept
Commentary_short: Faheem Ashraf to Gunathilaka, 1 run

Commentary: Imad again, round the wicket, targetting the top of off with minimal room to free the arms. Patted to the off side
Commentary_short: Imad Wasim to Gunathilaka, 1 run

Commentary: well bowled, wicket-to-wicket line from round the wicket, drawing a respectful forward defence
Commentary_short: Imad Wasim to Fernando, no run

Commentary: nudged to the covers, a sharp gather and shy hits the stumps, but good decisive calling from Gunathilaka ensures there's no danger
Commentary_short: Imad Wasim to Fernando, 1 run

Commentary: genuine edge, but there's no slip! Driven hard off the back foot, a fat edge eludes Sarfaraz - who had no chance - and flies to the boundary
Commentary_short: Imad Wasim to Gunathilaka, FOUR runs

Commentary: a bit more flight, pressed into the gap
Commentary_short: Imad Wasim to Gunathilaka, 1 run

Commentary: tip and run to the on-side, another well-judged single. Sri Lanka are hustling well, in spite of a tight start from Imad
Commentary_short: Imad Wasim to Fernando, 1 run

Commentary: banged in short, a cheeky open-faced jab down to third man to pick off the single
Commentary_short: Mohammad Hasnain to Fernando, 1 run

Commentary: short and leg-sided, that's a wasteful bouncer
Commentary_short: Mohammad Hasnain to Gunathilaka, 1 wide

Commentary: huge appeal but that's fizzed off the pad flap to the rope! Gunathilaka was rocking into a pull, the line was very straight, but was probably zipping over the top of the stumps...
Commentary_short: Mohammad Hasnain to Gunathilaka, 4 leg byes

Commentary: attempted scoop, can't connect, but the leg-side line earns the extra run anyway
Commentary_short: Mohammad Hasnain to Gunathilaka, 1 wide

Commentary: smoked to the rope! He read that short ball to perfection, was feinting to leg before the ball was released, and battered it on the up through point to deepen Hasnain's difficulties...
Commentary_short: Mohammad Hasnain to Gunathilaka, FOUR runs

Commentary: this is a practical lesson and a half! Hasnain comes round the wicket, but ends up feeding another sweet drive, the angle into the stumps being met by a measured and powerful punch through long-off
Commentary_short: Mohammad Hasnain to Gunathilaka, FOUR runs

Commentary: short, slightly leg-sided ... but umpire Dar shows mercy
Commentary_short: Mohammad Hasnain to Gunathilaka, no run

Commentary: flinched down to third man. The end of a very leaky first over from the energetic but erratic Hasnain
Commentary_short: Mohammad Hasnain to Gunathilaka, 1 run

Commentary: outside off, tight lines, doesn't reach Gunathilaka quite when he expects it, as a loose drive flaps into the covers
Commentary_short: Mohammad Amir to Gunathilaka, 1 run

Commentary: rising into the hip, jabbed to the leg side off the back foot
Commentary_short: Mohammad Amir to Fernando, 1 run

Commentary: yorker... perfectly well bowled, right into the blockhole, but that's exceptional angling from the batsman, jamming the bat down with an open face, and poaching a four through third man!
Commentary_short: Mohammad Amir to Gunathilaka, FOUR runs

Commentary: tapped to the off side, the runs keep clattering along
Commentary_short: Mohammad Amir to Gunathilaka, 2 runs

Commentary: slower ball, rising into the thigh as Amir asks an exploratory question. The fifty comes up with a scampered single to point
Commentary_short: Mohammad Amir to Gunathilaka, 1 leg bye

Commentary: edged, but inches short of Sarfaraz! He made superb ground, low to his right, but the ball just died on him. Good delivery, jagging late and scraping the outside edge of a befuddled bat... but Fernando survives!
Commentary_short: Mohammad Amir to Fernando, no run

Commentary: swept, gloriously through backward square! Down on one knee, picks his gap to perfection
Commentary_short: Shadab Khan to Gunathilaka, FOUR runs

Commentary: flogged with disdain high over midwicket! A half-tracker from Shadab, and he's in all sorts of bother already
Commentary_short: Shadab Khan to Gunathilaka, FOUR runs

Commentary: clipped firmly to the leg side, the runs keep haemorrhaging
Commentary_short: Shadab Khan to Gunathilaka, 2 runs

Commentary: crumbs, how has he survived that! Shadab grips one on off stump, and it beats leg by the slenderest of whiskers!
Commentary_short: Shadab Khan to Gunathilaka, no run

Commentary: belted on the sweep once more! This is carnage... backward square is the target once more
Commentary_short: Shadab Khan to Gunathilaka, FOUR runs

Commentary: faster and flatter, thumps the pad, and that's the end of the Powerplay. A powerful one at that!
Commentary_short: Shadab Khan to Gunathilaka, no run

Commentary: tight lines, dabbed to the off side, and that's superb opportunistic running. Fernando more than happy to trust the rampant Gunathilaka with the calling and the scoring!
Commentary_short: Faheem Ashraf to Fernando, 1 run

Commentary: on the back foot, clobbered once more, but doesn't quite connect on the drive to short cover
Commentary_short: Faheem Ashraf to Gunathilaka, no run

Commentary: clipped off the toes out through midwicket
Commentary_short: Faheem Ashraf to Gunathilaka, 1 run

Commentary: on the back foot, nudged off the pads and another single to the cause. 12 off 12 ... quite the support role from Fernando
Commentary_short: Faheem Ashraf to Fernando, 1 run

Commentary: opens the face and pokes to point, looking to go rather finer, I sense, but can't get this one away. A rare dot!
Commentary_short: Faheem Ashraf to Gunathilaka, no run

Commentary: width once more, but deep point is well placed to sweep up another bludgeoning back-foot drive
Commentary_short: Faheem Ashraf to Gunathilaka, 1 run

Commentary: tucked off the legs, another single
Commentary_short: Shadab Khan to Gunathilaka, 1 run

Commentary: on the back foot, tighter line from Shadab, punched to short cover
Commentary_short: Shadab Khan to Fernando, no run

Commentary: well bowled, just the beginnings of pressure in this over as Shadab finds his length with a touch of turn
Commentary_short: Shadab Khan to Fernando, no run

Commentary: leaning forward, tight lines again, clipped to midwicket for another dot
Commentary_short: Shadab Khan to Fernando, 1 run

Commentary: spoke too soon, bowled too short! Gunathilaka leans back with glee, batters the length high and mightily over midwicket, and up comes a rampant half-century!
Commentary_short: Shadab Khan to Gunathilaka, SIX runs

Commentary: flicks to the on-side, another single to keep the strike
Commentary_short: Shadab Khan to Gunathilaka, 1 run

Commentary: round the wicket, dipping into the toes, clipped to the on-side
Commentary_short: Imad Wasim to Gunathilaka, 1 run

Commentary: pushed onto the back foot, high-elbowed punch to mid-on
Commentary_short: Imad Wasim to Fernando, 1 run

Commentary: elegantly driven down to long-off, striding to the pitch with confidence
Commentary_short: Imad Wasim to Gunathilaka, 1 run

Commentary: sweet timing, but a fine one-handed pouch at short cover to intercept
Commentary_short: Imad Wasim to Fernando, no run

Commentary: frustration for Fernando as he rocks back to slap hard down the ground, but can't get past the bowler
Commentary_short: Imad Wasim to Fernando, no run

Commentary: worked around the front pad, the single will have to suffice for Fernando, who keeps the strike. A fine over in tough circumstances, and he's just tightened things up a touch
Commentary_short: Imad Wasim to Fernando, 1 run

Commentary: battered hard into the covers, opening his stance a touch to create an angle, but can't beat the field
Commentary_short: Shadab Khan to Fernando, 1 run

Commentary: skids through low, but that's pitched outside leg as it crashes into the shin!
Commentary_short: Shadab Khan to Gunathilaka, no run

Commentary: bottom-handed clobber out to deep point, seizing on the extra hang-time in that delivery... and they rush back for the second. Gunathilaka has to fling himself for the crease to be sure...
Commentary_short: Shadab Khan to Gunathilaka, 2 runs

Commentary: up goes the finger! But Gunathilaka reviews. He looked less than impressed at the initial call, and it may have pitched on and around leg stump as Gunathilaka unfurled the sweep and missed. It is clipping leg on umpire's call! The verdict stands!
Commentary_short: Shadab Khan to Gunathilaka, OUT
Dismissal_text: MD Gunathilaka lbw b Shadab Khan 57 (38b 8x4 1x6) SR: 150.00

Commentary: keeps a touch low, but kept out with a front-foot poke
Commentary_short: Shadab Khan to Rajapaksa, no run

Commentary: head over the ball, watchful in defence as he gets the measure of the conditions
Commentary_short: Shadab Khan to Rajapaksa, no run

Commentary: short, and frankly rubbish... a sluggish long-hop down the leg side, and swivel-pulled through backward square!
Commentary_short: Iftikhar Ahmed to Fernando, FOUR runs

Commentary: that's streets better! Tighter line, thumps the pad as Fernando misses a sweep, and Sarfaraz reviews! It struck him low on the bended knee, and might have been heading for leg stump? We'll soon see ... nope, it's clipping! On we go.
Commentary_short: Iftikhar Ahmed to Fernando, no run

Commentary: back of a length, soft-handed defence into the covers
Commentary_short: Iftikhar Ahmed to Fernando, 1 run

Commentary: well bowled! Round the wicket, bites the deck, leaps past the edge of a tentative poke
Commentary_short: Iftikhar Ahmed to Rajapaksa, no run

Commentary: arm-ball, thumps the pad, but sliding down leg! Rajapaksa is not feeling it yet ...
Commentary_short: Iftikhar Ahmed to Rajapaksa, no run

Commentary: width, and a chance to carve his first runs in international cricket, through backward point. That'll help him settle
Commentary_short: Iftikhar Ahmed to Rajapaksa, 2 runs

Commentary: can't get this one away, as Pakistan continue to regroup
Commentary_short: Shadab Khan to Fernando, no run

Commentary: flashed into the off side, off the back foot. A single will suffice
Commentary_short: Shadab Khan to Fernando, 1 run

Commentary: down on one knee, and that's more like it! Swept with power, and lots of bottom hand, lining up the angle round the wicket, and hitting with the turn, over midwicket!
Commentary_short: Shadab Khan to Rajapaksa, SIX runs

Commentary: tip and run to backward point, and the runs are suddenly back!
Commentary_short: Shadab Khan to Rajapaksa, 1 run

Commentary: flicked off the legs to the on-side, and up comes the 100. They are on course for a biggie
Commentary_short: Shadab Khan to Fernando, 1 run

Commentary: whoops, gives himself too much room, and can't reach with a cut through point
Commentary_short: Shadab Khan to Rajapaksa, no run

Commentary: a gallop to the pitch, but still can't quite get there, a drag to the leg side ensues
Commentary_short: Imad Wasim to Fernando, 1 run

Commentary: makes room for the flick over the shoulder, exposing the stumps, and picking it off exquisitely! Clean through fine leg
Commentary_short: Imad Wasim to Rajapaksa, FOUR runs

Commentary: tapped to the covers
Commentary_short: Imad Wasim to Rajapaksa, 1 run

Commentary: a massive heave-ho ... nowhere near the ball as it bit and turned with a change of pace, just back of a length
Commentary_short: Imad Wasim to Fernando, no run

Commentary: flicked off the legs for another single
Commentary_short: Imad Wasim to Fernando, 1 run

Commentary: flogged to point, can't beat the fielder
Commentary_short: Imad Wasim to Rajapaksa, no run

Commentary: cracked with intent but not a lot of timing, out to deep midwicket
Commentary_short: Mohammad Hasnain to Fernando, 1 run

Commentary: on the back foot, hitting the bat hard from round the wicket, and a sharp single to the off side ... very sharp in fact, as the ensuing shy raps him on the elbow as he makes his ground at the non-striker's end!
Commentary_short: Mohammad Hasnain to Rajapaksa, 1 run

Commentary: a high full-toss, and Fernando muffs his slog! So badly timed, in fact, he has time to rush back for the second, albeit with a desperate dive
Commentary_short: Mohammad Hasnain to Fernando, 2 runs

Commentary: short, and slow, pulled inelegantly to the leg side
Commentary_short: Mohammad Hasnain to Fernando, 1 run

Commentary: on the back foot again, sharp pace and tight lines, poked to the off side
Commentary_short: Mohammad Hasnain to Rajapaksa, 1 run

Commentary: a touch of width, a wild slap through third man! They all count, a fat spiralling leading edge, and it travels too fast for the fielder to cut it off!
Commentary_short: Mohammad Hasnain to Fernando, FOUR runs

Commentary: outside off, can't connect with a woolly swipe to nothing
Commentary_short: Mohammad Amir to Rajapaksa, no run

Commentary: firmly pumped down the ground, meeting Amir on a good length with a straight-lined waft of the bat
Commentary_short: Mohammad Amir to Rajapaksa, 2 runs

Commentary: short, and pulled firmly to deep midwicket. Another good connection, if not perfectly placed
Commentary_short: Mohammad Amir to Rajapaksa, 1 run

Commentary: a bottom-handed flog to mid-off, and Shadab's shy is pinpoint! Fernando set off for an instinctive single, but was never at the races as the ball reached the fielder too quickly, and the fielder reached the stumps with equal speed! A decent innings, never really got up to full speed. But he's given his side the platform to have a real go now
Commentary_short: Mohammad Amir to Fernando, OUT
Dismissal_text: WIA Fernando run out (Shadab Khan) 33 (34b 3x4 0x6) SR: 97.05

Commentary: pulled with power and placement! Picked the length early and hit with the angle, round the corner and past the despairing deep backward square
Commentary_short: Mohammad Amir to Rajapaksa, FOUR runs

Commentary: picked up well once more, a slower ball, clobbered uppishly to deep midwicket
Commentary_short: Mohammad Amir to Rajapaksa, 2 runs

Commentary: stabbed to short cover, and Sarfaraz is livid that there was a run available there. Sri Lanka remain sparky between the wickets
Commentary_short: Mohammad Hasnain to Shanaka, 1 run

Commentary: oof, that's utterly pummelled over long-off! Slower ball, in the slot, Rajapaksa cleared the front leg and mowed through the line with shoulders rotating sweetly through the stroke
Commentary_short: Mohammad Hasnain to Rajapaksa, SIX runs

Commentary: back of a length, chopped down to third man, this is an impressive first bow from the new boy
Commentary_short: Mohammad Hasnain to Rajapaksa, 1 run

Commentary: too short, and pulled to deep midwicket
Commentary_short: Mohammad Hasnain to Shanaka, 1 run

Commentary: short, and well bowled, within the limits according to the square leg umpire... hmm ... not so sure, but it'll do!
Commentary_short: Mohammad Hasnain to Rajapaksa, no run

Commentary: perfect yorker! It was going to take a special delivery to end an increasingly special innings, round the wicket, roaring into the toes, and up goes the finger as Rajapaksa fails to get his bat down in time. Still, he's made a fine first impression
Commentary_short: Mohammad Hasnain to Rajapaksa, OUT
Dismissal_text: PBB Rajapaksa lbw b Mohammad Hasnain 32 (22b 2x4 2x6) SR: 145.45

Commentary: very full length, firmly pumped back down the track, half a hand to take the pace off
Commentary_short: Faheem Ashraf to Shanaka, 1 run

Commentary: aiming for the yorker once more, stabbed to cover, a direct hit would have been very close indeed!
Commentary_short: Faheem Ashraf to Jayasuriya, no run

Commentary: a wild swipe across the line, a steepling top-edge ... but short of third man!
Commentary_short: Faheem Ashraf to Jayasuriya, 1 run

Commentary: that's one of those sixes that you call on sound alone! Banjaxed out of the blockhole, high and raucous into the night sky, and over the cow corner rope!
Commentary_short: Faheem Ashraf to Shanaka, SIX runs

Commentary: and so's that! Faheem drags his length back, and the skipper latches onto it with disdain! Rocking back, pulled off the front foot, high into the midwicket stands!
Commentary_short: Faheem Ashraf to Shanaka, SIX runs

Commentary: full length but a change of pace, Shanaka angles his bat into a defensive steer and picks off the single to third man
Commentary_short: Faheem Ashraf to Shanaka, 1 run

Commentary: well bowled, ghosting past the outside edge, flirting with the tramlines as the ball bends away from the right-hander
Commentary_short: Mohammad Amir to Shanaka, no run

Commentary: charging to the pitch, Amir saw him coming and cramped him for room, thumping his pads and settling for the leg-bye
Commentary_short: Mohammad Amir to Shanaka, 1 leg bye

Commentary: dabbed to the off side, keeping the senior man on strike as much as possible
Commentary_short: Mohammad Amir to Jayasuriya, 1 run

Commentary: down on one knee, looking to paddle over the head of short fine leg, but he can't get enough bat on this one
Commentary_short: Mohammad Amir to Shanaka, 1 run

Commentary: huge appeal for caught behind after an extraordinary passage of play! Pakistan review after a game of cat and mouse from batsman and bowler, Jayasuriya was back on his stumps, legs splayed and torso presented to the bowler like a really bad attempt to play French cricket. He tried to flick the ball over his shoulder, but there's no spike on Snicko. Not out!
Commentary_short: Mohammad Amir to Jayasuriya, no run

Commentary: right up to the blockhole, you can't get those ones away. Well bowled from Amir
Commentary_short: Mohammad Amir to Jayasuriya, no run

Commentary: smashed out to deep long-on, but he's not got hold of this! A flog through the line once more, and there's a collision as Umar Akmal lines up the catch! He's clung on in the end, but that could have been very nasty indeed... instead it's a timely wicket!
Commentary_short: Mohammad Hasnain to Shanaka, OUT
Dismissal_text: MD Shanaka c Umar Akmal b Mohammad Hasnain 17 (10b 0x4 2x6) SR: 170.00

Commentary: cramped for room from round the wicket, and it's two wickets in two balls! A flaccid flapped slog into the covers, comes off the splice and lobs to Shehzad ... suddenly 180 seems a long way away!
Commentary_short: Mohammad Hasnain to Jayasuriya, OUT
Dismissal_text: GSNFG Jayasuriya c Ahmed Shehzad b Mohammad Hasnain 2 (6b 0x4 0x6) SR: 33.33

Commentary: outside off, and through to the keeper ...
Commentary_short: Mohammad Hasnain to de Silva, no run

Commentary: opens the face, pushed to the off side
Commentary_short: Mohammad Hasnain to de Silva, 1 run

Commentary: flicked off the toes, to deep midwicket
Commentary_short: Mohammad Hasnain to Udana, 1 run

Commentary: flapped up and over mid-off! That was improbably well timed, as de Silva rocked back, punched with oodles of bottom hand back through the line, and picked off a vital boundary!
Commentary_short: Mohammad Hasnain to de Silva, FOUR runs

Commentary: crashed hard through point, hitting with the angle across the right-hander
Commentary_short: Mohammad Amir to Udana, 2 runs

Commentary: fine leg is up, as Amir aims full, tempting the batsman to improvise. He can't get the shot away
Commentary_short: Mohammad Amir to Udana, 1 run

Commentary: clangs the visor! No concerns from the batsman, as Amir speared in a bouncer that followed the batsman's attempt to swing into a pull
Commentary_short: Mohammad Amir to de Silva, no run

Commentary: solid connection on the drill to deep cover, but Amir's bowling to his field well here
Commentary_short: Mohammad Amir to de Silva, 1 run

Commentary: yorker, well bowled, right up to the toes, and forced out to the leg side with a bottom-handed wipe
Commentary_short: Mohammad Amir to Udana, 1 run

Commentary: yorker once more, that is a superb final over, as Pakistan regroup well to keep Sri Lanka to 165 for 5.
Commentary_short: Mohammad Amir to de Silva, 1 run

Commentary: ...and he finds some swing right away. Full and swerving away outside off, no shot
Commentary_short: Rajitha to Babar Azam, no run

Commentary: back of a length and holds its line outside off, punched up to extra-cover
Commentary_short: Rajitha to Babar Azam, no run

Commentary: short, wide, cracked away in front of square on the off side for four. Babar reaches out for the ball and cuts it strongly between point and covers
Commentary_short: Rajitha to Babar Azam, FOUR runs

Commentary: back of a length and straight, tucked straight to short fine leg
Commentary_short: Rajitha to Babar Azam, no run

Commentary: dipping full-toss outside off, Babar waits for it to arrive and picks it away through the vacant spaces at midwicket. Sandakan runs across to his left and boots the ball into play. Snazzy footwork in the outfield from Sandakan
Commentary_short: Rajitha to Babar Azam, 3 runs

Commentary: good length and nibbling away outside off, ignored by the comeback man Shehzad
Commentary_short: Rajitha to Ahmed Shehzad, no run

Commentary: on a length and outside off, run away to point
Commentary_short: Pradeep to Babar Azam, no run

Commentary: shorter and outside off, Babar is early into his back-foot punch winds up chipping it over point
Commentary_short: Pradeep to Babar Azam, 2 runs

Commentary: back of a length and holds its line outside off, tapped down to mid-off off the front foot
Commentary_short: Pradeep to Babar Azam, no run

Commentary: Babar! Babar! Babar! Just short of a good length and just a shade outside off, Babar steps across, punches it on the up to the right of mid-on. Shot of the night for me
Commentary_short: Pradeep to Babar Azam, FOUR runs

Commentary: there's the riposte from Pradeep! Good length, angling in and straightening away outside off, Babar looks to drive on the up, but Pradeep finds some extra bounce and movement to foil Babar's plans. Nicked off to Banuka the debutant
Commentary_short: Pradeep to Babar Azam, OUT
Dismissal_text: Babar Azam c †Bhanuka b Pradeep 13 (10b 2x4 0x6) SR: 130.00

Commentary: Umar Akmal bags a golden duck on return! This looks plumb, and Umar knows it, as he drags himself off the field. Full and angling in, swinging in towards middle, Umar plays all around his front pad and Pradeep traps him. Sri Lanka have separated Umar and Shehzad so very quickly
Commentary_short: Pradeep to Umar Akmal, OUT
Dismissal_text: Umar Akmal lbw b Pradeep 0 (1b 0x4 0x6) SR: 0.00

Commentary: another lbw appeal, this time from Rajitha. Not given out by Dar. SL choose to challenge the on-field not-out decision. Good length, slanting in from over the wicket, hits the back thigh, height could be an issue. Ultra Edge confirms that there was no bat involved. And the tracker returns umpire's call. Shehzad just about survives
Commentary_short: Rajitha to Ahmed Shehzad, no run

Commentary: back of a length and angling into the hips, deflected only as far as short fine leg
Commentary_short: Rajitha to Ahmed Shehzad, 1 leg bye

Commentary: good length and on a fourth-stump line, Sarfaraz plays it back to the bowler
Commentary_short: Rajitha to Sarfaraz Ahmed, no run

Commentary: tip and run to the covers. Well done, Pakistan
Commentary_short: Rajitha to Sarfaraz Ahmed, 1 run

Commentary: shortish and outside off, jabbed away to point
Commentary_short: Rajitha to Ahmed Shehzad, no run

Commentary: Shehzad leans back to a length ball outside off and toe-ends it to the covers
Commentary_short: Rajitha to Ahmed Shehzad, no run

Commentary: shortish and outside off, flapped to mid-on. Hat-trick averted
Commentary_short: Pradeep to Sarfaraz Ahmed, no run

Commentary: back of a length and outside off, Sarfaraz rides the bounce and chops it away to deep point
Commentary_short: Pradeep to Sarfaraz Ahmed, 1 run

Commentary: back of a length and angling into a back-foot punch to the right of mid-on
Commentary_short: Pradeep to Ahmed Shehzad, 1 run

Commentary: Sarfaraz taps a length ball in front of mid-on and calls his partner through for a swift single
Commentary_short: Pradeep to Sarfaraz Ahmed, 1 run

Commentary: short and shoved down the leg side, away from the reach of the batsman's pull, wide called
Commentary_short: Pradeep to Ahmed Shehzad, 1 wide

Commentary: shortish and outside off, Shehzad throws his bat at ball and splices it to the covers
Commentary_short: Pradeep to Ahmed Shehzad, 1 run

Commentary: think this is the slower ball, on middle, Sarfaraz keeps it out and closes out the over
Commentary_short: Pradeep to Sarfaraz Ahmed, no run

Commentary: he draws a leading edge, three fielders converge, but the ball drops into no-man's land on the off side. Slower cutter from Udana, Shehzad aims for the leg side and skews it over the off-side infield in the end
Commentary_short: Udana to Ahmed Shehzad, 2 runs

Commentary: Chopped on. Low-key returns for both Umar and Shehzad. Shortish and outside off from over the stumps, Shehzad, picked ahead of Fakhar, camps on the back foot. This is neither a punch or a cut. He plays a shot that's somewhere in between and drags a thick inside edge back onto the stumps
Commentary_short: Udana to Ahmed Shehzad, OUT

Commentary: back of a length and outside off, crisply punched on the up to extra-cover
Commentary_short: Udana to Iftikhar Ahmed, no run

Commentary: shorter and outside off, crunched to extra-cover once again
Commentary_short: Udana to Iftikhar Ahmed, no run

Commentary: overpitched and just a shade outside off, nicely driven through the line but straight to the man at mid-off
Commentary_short: Udana to Iftikhar Ahmed, no run

Commentary: crunched again, this time in the gap. On a length and outside off, Ahmed reaches out for the ball and belts it away to the left of extra-cover. All hands, and wrists in that shot
Commentary_short: Udana to Iftikhar Ahmed, FOUR runs

Commentary: lobbed up on off, driven down to long-on
Commentary_short: de Silva to Sarfaraz Ahmed, 1 run

Commentary: skids on outside off, forced off the back foot to the left of cover
Commentary_short: de Silva to Iftikhar Ahmed, 1 run

Commentary: flighted and outside off, Sarfaraz swings for the hills, and sends an inside edge to square leg
Commentary_short: de Silva to Sarfaraz Ahmed, no run

Commentary: mighty full on off, Sarfaraz can't get underneath the length, stabbed to mid-on

Commentary: looks like a googly, slides back in, Sarfaraz goes on the back foot, taps to cover, and races across to the other end. A direct hit at the striker's end could have had Ahmed

Commentary: slider on middle, 93ks, stabbed off the back foot to square leg.

Commentary: flatter and shorter on middle, hauled to long-on off the back foot
Commentary_short: Sandakan to Iftikhar Ahmed, 1 run

Commentary: sliding across off from over the wicket, fizzes past the outside edge
Commentary_short: Sandakan to Sarfaraz Ahmed, no run

Commentary: short stock ball on off stump, Sarfaraz goes on the back foot and drags the ball to long-on
Commentary_short: Sandakan to Sarfaraz Ahmed, 1 run

Commentary: wrong'un, breaks away outside off, chopped off the back foot through cover-point region
Commentary_short: Sandakan to Iftikhar Ahmed, 1 run

Commentary: dragged down outside off, smeared down to long-on, although not off the middle of the bat
Commentary_short: Sandakan to Sarfaraz Ahmed, 1 run

Commentary: stock ball, full and breaks back in, nurdled away to the leg side past the right of the bowler for one

Commentary: full on middle, skewed to long-on off the inside half

Commentary: tossed on middle, the captain manufactures swinging room and goes inside-out over extra-cover

Commentary: flighted and turns away a wee bit outside off, eased through the line to long-off

Commentary: skids towards off stump, whisked away to cover off the front foot for one

Commentary: Sarfraz stretches out, gets outside the line of the stumps, and misses the sweep, weathering the lbw shout from Hasaranga
Commentary_short: de Silva to Sarfaraz Ahmed, 1 leg bye

Commentary: dirty long-hop on middle, begs on its knees to be put away. Iftikhar  obliges and pings it away to the midwicket boundary with a back-foot pull
Commentary_short: de Silva to Iftikhar Ahmed, FOUR runs

Commentary: pushed through on middle, tipped to short cover. They take on the fielder's arm for a single. Shanaka throws it to Sandakan, but the bowler wasn't ready to gather the throw. A run-out chance goes abegging
Commentary_short: Sandakan to Sarfaraz Ahmed, 1 run

Commentary: short on middle, heaved away to the leg side for one
Commentary_short: Sandakan to Iftikhar Ahmed, 1 run

Commentary: down the track and driven down to long-on
Commentary_short: Sandakan to Sarfaraz Ahmed, 1 run

Commentary: fuller and outside off, driven through the line to long-off

Commentary: Sarfraz stretches out to meet a full-toss and sweep it just wide of short fine leg. The fielder slides and gets a hand to the ball

Commentary: long-hop on middle, Sandakan gets away with that, pulled to deep midwicket

Commentary: picked off the pads to long leg

Commentary: full and angling into the leg stump, off the pads and rolls behind square on the leg side

Commentary: Rajitha hits a hard length outside off, punched straight to sweeper on the off side

Commentary: slower ball, full and plunges on Sarfaraz, he adjusts and taps it to long-on
Commentary_short: Rajitha to Sarfaraz Ahmed, 1 run

Commentary: fullish on off, punched on the up to mid-off
Commentary_short: Rajitha to Iftikhar Ahmed, no run

Commentary: short at the hips, diverted away through square leg for a brace

Commentary: full and flighted outside off, swept flat and hard to deep midwicket

Commentary: ooooh, what's this? Sandakan aims for the slider and almost lands it on the adjacent pitch. Off-side wide

Commentary: floated up outside off, drilled to short extra cover, bursts through the hands of the fielder
Commentary_short: Sandakan to Iftikhar Ahmed, 2 runs

Commentary: pitches outside leg and then straightens to thump the pad, not given lbw. Shanaka calls for a review.
Commentary_short: Sandakan to Iftikhar Ahmed, no run

Commentary: darted into the pads, glanced away to square leg for a scampered single
Commentary_short: Sandakan to Iftikhar Ahmed, 1 run

Commentary: pitches outside leg once again, dips and hits the pad, beating the batsman on the sweep

Commentary: looped up on middle, Sarfaraz breaks free with an inside-out loft over extra-cover. He makes room and lifts it over the infield
Commentary_short: Sandakan to Sarfaraz Ahmed, FOUR runs

Commentary: dipping full-toss from over the wicket, the batsman does not connect with a sweep and is hit outside leg. Back-of-the-hand variation from Udana

Commentary: dug in short and outside off, patted through cover-point
Commentary_short: Udana to Sarfaraz Ahmed, 1 run

Commentary: Awful mix-up between the wickets: sort of encapsulates the chase from Pakistan. Near yorker on off stump, jammed away to mid-off's left. Sarfaraz takes off in search of a quick single, but Iftikhar isn't interested. Both batsman are hustling towards the crease at the striker's end. The throw is to the non-striker's end and Udana flips the bails off. Sarfaraz comes first in this little dash at the striker's end, Iftikhar has to exit
Commentary_short: Udana to Iftikhar Ahmed, OUT

Commentary: short and outside off, slapped away to deep third man
Commentary_short: Udana to Sarfaraz Ahmed, 1 run

Commentary: back of a length and angling across off, punched to the right of deep third man
Commentary_short: Udana to Asif Ali, 1 run

Commentary: jabbed away to sweeper cover for a single

Commentary: tossed on leg stump, swept flat and hard to the right of deep square leg
Commentary_short: Sandakan to Sarfaraz Ahmed, 1 run

Commentary: wrong'un, short and turns away outside off, chopped to extra-cover
Commentary_short: Sandakan to Asif Ali, no run

Commentary: Asif ventures down the track, but is nowhere close to the pitch and chips a leading edge to the left of the bowler. Another googly from Sandakan

Commentary: dragged from off or just a shade outside to deep square leg

Commentary: flighted on middle, reverse-swept only as far as Danushka diving to his right at slip

Commentary: flighted and full on off, driven down to long-off
Commentary_short: Sandakan to Asif Ali, 1 run

Commentary: tossed on middle, Asif goes for a mighty slog-sweep and only inside-edges it towards short fine leg
Commentary_short: de Silva to Asif Ali, 1 run

Commentary: bowled'em. Sarfaraz has been put out of his misery. This was coming, wasn't it? He marches down the track, goes for a big heave-ho, and does not make any contact. Hasranga nails the stumps with a straighter one

Commentary: fuller and just a shade outside off, whipped through the midwicket region

Commentary: off-stump yorker, dug out

Commentary: full on the pads, picked up and the ball landed in front of deep square leg
Commentary_short: Rajitha to Faheem Ashraf, 1 run

Commentary: slider from Hasaranga, beats the reverse-sweep, hits the pad, and wanders away. Not given out lbw. It looks very tight, but SL have exhausted their review

Commentary: liberally tossed up on off stump, Asif Ali aims to launch it downtown. He does not get hold of it though and winds up slicing it in the air. Danushka, SL's first-innings hero, runs across to his left and grabs the catch

Commentary: good length and sliding across off, edged to short third man

Commentary: Pradeep bowls a yorker on middle stump, Ashraf clears his front leg and scythes it up and over extra-cover. That's some hit from Ashraf

Commentary: length ball on off, Ashraf wants to slog this out of the Gadaffi Stadium, instead he splices it back to the bowler

Commentary: full on off, driven with an open face to sweeper cover

Commentary: full-toss on the pads, picked up and hit into the lap of Danushka at deep square leg. Ashraf adds to Pakistan's collapse. The umpires check for a possible front-foot no-ball, but Pradeep is okay on that count as well. Ashraf has to keep going

Commentary: pretty full on middle, Shadab sizes it up and scoops it with the bottom hand over mid-off. Some belated cheer for the Lahore fans

Commentary: Amir moves away outside leg, Udana follows him, jabbed into the off side
Commentary_short: Udana to Mohammad Amir, 1 run

Commentary: wide yorker, squeezed back to Udana
Commentary_short: Udana to Shadab Khan, no run

Commentary: Shadab holes out to Avishka at deep midwicket. Slower short ball outside off, Shadab, having shuffled across off, slogs this back-of-the-hand variation to the outfielder
Commentary_short: Udana to Shadab Khan, OUT
Dismissal_text: Shadab Khan c Fernando b Udana 6 (7b 1x4 0x6) SR: 85.71

Commentary: That is that! A second-string SL side tramples the No.1 T20I team. Udana sews up an emphatic win for the visitors. Amir makes some swinging room and mis-hits another slower ball into the lap of long-off
Commentary_short: Udana to Mohammad Amir, OUT
Dismissal_text: Mohammad Amir c Gunathilaka b Udana 1 (2b 0x4 0x6) SR: 50.00
